squidpony.bootstrap

Interface GameLogic


  • @Beta
public interface GameLogic
    This interface indicates the ability to perform the game logic associated with GUI input. Intended for use with the bootsrap SFrame.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acceptDirectionInput(Direction dir)
      Sends a single direction that was pressed.
      void acceptKeyboardInput(char key)
      Sends a single character that was pressed.
      void acceptMoustInput(int x, int y)
      Sends the grid coordinates of a mouse click.
      void beginGame()
      Called once the GUI is completely displayed and ready for input.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptKeyboardInput

        void acceptKeyboardInput(char key)
        Sends a single character that was pressed. Accounts for the shift key state. Will not send a character for arrow keys or numbers on the numpad as those are sent through the acceptDirectionInput() method.
        Parameters:
        key - the key that was pressed

      • acceptDirectionInput

        void acceptDirectionInput(Direction dir)
        Sends a single direction that was pressed. This is from the arrow keys and the numpad arrow keys. Ignores numpad lock state so number mode will still return directions.
        Parameters:
        dir -

      • acceptMoustInput

        void acceptMoustInput(int x,
                    int y)
        Sends the grid coordinates of a mouse click. Will not send clicks that originated in the message and stat panels.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • beginGame

        void beginGame()
        Called once the GUI is completely displayed and ready for input. The initial visual representation of the game should be created here. After this all visual updates will need to be in response to mouse or keyboard input.
